sn36.11:4.4: “Just now, sir, as I was in private solitude this thought came to mind.
sn36.11:4.5: The Buddha has spoken of three feelings.

sn36.11:5.2: I have spoken of these three feelings.

sn36.11:5.15: But I have also explained the progressive cessation of conditions.
sn36.11:5.16: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has ceased.
sn36.11:5.17: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have ceased.
sn36.11:5.18: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has ceased.
sn36.11:5.19: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has ceased.
sn36.11:5.20: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite space, the perception of form has ceased.
sn36.11:5.21: For someone who has attained the dimension of infinite consciousness, the perception of the dimension of infinite space has ceased.
sn36.11:5.22: For someone who has attained the dimension of nothingness, the perception of the dimension of infinite consciousness has ceased.
sn36.11:5.23: For someone who has attained the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, the perception of the dimension of nothingness has ceased.
sn36.11:5.24: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have ceased.
sn36.11:5.25: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have ceased.
sn36.11:5.26: And I have also explained the progressive stilling of conditions.
sn36.11:5.27: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has stilled.
sn36.11:5.28: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have stilled. …
sn36.11:5.29: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have stilled.
sn36.11:5.30: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have stilled.
sn36.11:5.31: There are these six levels of tranquility.
sn36.11:5.32: For someone who has attained the first absorption, speech has been tranquilized.
sn36.11:5.33: For someone who has attained the second absorption, the placing of the mind and keeping it connected have been tranquilized.
sn36.11:5.34: For someone who has attained the third absorption, rapture has been tranquilized.
sn36.11:5.35: For someone who has attained the fourth absorption, breathing has been tranquilized.
sn36.11:5.36: For someone who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, perception and feeling have been tranquilized.
sn36.11:5.37: For a mendicant who has ended the defilements, greed, hate, and delusion have been tranquilized.”
